verses.text: "The leech has two daughters. 'Give! Give!' they cry. "There are three things that are never satisfied, four that never say, 'Enough!':
the grave, the barren womb, land, which is never satisfied with water, and fire, which never says, 'Enough!'

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:15–31
rsbNotes.text: 30:15–31 On the form of these numerical sayings, see notes 6:16–19.

rsbNotes.title: Pr 30:15
rsbNotes.text: 30:15 The leech . . . “Give” and “Give.” The two ends of the leech look the same, and the animal seems to have no function except to devour. The following numerical sayings share the theme of greed.
